Maurer discusses what can be done to tackle global inequities and what he sees as the greatest humanitarian crises in the years ahead. Join Washington Post Live on Monday, June 7 at 3:00pm ET.

headline: OpinionIf Trump is so tough on terrorism, why did the Taliban just endorse him?
snippet: Trump’s real record on terrorism is far less impressive than he claims.

headline: Christopher Miller, Trump’s surprise acting defense secretary, has a thin resume for the job but deep experience in counterterrorism
snippet: Miller takes over on an acting basis after the president fired Mark Esper.

headline: The Path Forward: Safeguarding Global Innovation with Keith J. Krach & Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal
snippet: With 5G technology and quantum computing to artificial intelligence and energy infrastructure, how can the United States embrace the latest global technologies while safeguarding our national security? Veteran Silicon Valley CEO and former undersecretary of state Keith J. Krach and retired four-star Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal, former U.S. and International Security Assistance Forces (ISAF) commander, join Washington Post columnist David Ignatius to explore how the U.S. and its strategic partners can build a global cyber-trust network to protect the innovation of tomorrow. Join Washington Post Live on Thursday, April 22 at 11:00am ET.

headline: ‘Extremely difficult, but not impossible’: General provides assessment of Afghan counterterrorism effort after U.S. troops depart
snippet: U.S. will not return to Afghanistan ‘under any conceivable circumstances,’ Centcom commander said.

headline: AnalysisThe Daily 202: Pelosi announces Jan. 6 probe, as Biden officials warn of threat from 'lone actors'
snippet: There's relatively little 'large-scale organization,' homeland security adviser says.

headline: The Path Forward: Mastering Risk with Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal (U.S. Army, Ret.) and Anna Butrico
snippet: Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal (U.S. Army, Ret.) is the former commander of U.S. Forces Afghanistan and of the nation’s premier military counter-terrorism force, Joint Special Operations Command. The warrior-scholar, comfortable with diplomats, politicians and military men alike, has lived a life full of risk. In a new book, “Risk: A User's Guide,” McChrystal and co-author Anna Butrico highlight the key factors that determine how we detect and respond to risk. Join Washington Post columnist David Ignatius on Monday, Oct. 4 at 10:00 a.m. ET.

headline: OpinionInside the CIA’s desperate effort to rescue its Afghan allies
snippet: The agency's officers and local partners were among the last out of Kabul, working undercover to evacuate as many Americans and Afghans as possible.

headline: Jan. 6: One Year Later with Aquilino Gonell & Donell Harvin, DrPH
snippet: The attack on the U.S. Capitol on January 6 has had an undeniable impact on the people who were there that day. Join Washington Post Live on Tuesday, Jan. 4 at 1:00 p.m. ET when former Chief of Homeland Security and Intelligence for the District of Columbia Donell Harvin, and others who were on the frontlines that day, discuss how the events at the U.S. Capitol played out in front of them and the impact it has had on their lives.
